translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kuṇḍadhāna

analyzed: kāḷ u dāyi ttheḥ a padāna
translated: The Elder Kāḷudāyī’s Birth Story
“Padumuttara, the Buddha,🔽the world’s chief, the one of great patience,
while on his journey,🔽while walking on walking tour,
I took a blooming lotus,
a blue lotus, and a jasmine flower,
and after taking the best food,
I gave it to the Teacher.
The Great Hero ate
the best food, the good meal,
and after taking the flower,
he showed it to the people.
The flower, which is desired, loved, and dear in the world,

analyzed: jala jam puppham uttama  su dukkaram katam tena
translated: the best of water-born flowers,🔽was given to me by one
who did what is very difficult to do.
He who placed the flower
and gave me the best food,
I will praise him,
listen to me as I speak.
‘For ten times eight eons
he will rule as a king of gods;
Blue lotuses, red lotuses,
and jasmine flowers are not as good as that.
Through the ripening of his merit,

analyzed: dibba gandha samāyuta  ākāse chadanam katvā
translated: mixed with divine fragrance,🔽he will hold up a canopy
in the sky for a long time.
Twenty-five times a wheel-turning monarch,
he will rule the earth for five hundred years.
In a period of a thousand world-cycles,

analyzed: okkāka kula sambhavaḥ  gotamaḥ nāma gottena
translated: one born in the Okkāka family,
will be a teacher in the world,🔽known as Gotama by clan.
He will be one who has attained the divine abodes,
and will be urged on by the root of merit.
He will be the joy of the Sakyans,
a kinsman and a friend.
Later, after going forth,
he will be urged on by the root of merit.
Having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished, without pollutants.
He will have attained the analytical knowledges,
his work done, without pollutants.
Gotama, the kinsman of the world,
will place him at the head.
He will be one who is intent on striving,
peaceful, without possessions.
His name will be Udāyī,

original: hessati satthu sāvako’.🔽Rāgo doso ca moho ca,
analyzed: hessati satthu sāvakaḥ  rāgaḥ dosaḥ ca mohaḥ ca
translated: a disciple of the Teacher.’🔽Craving, hatred, and delusion,
conceit, contempt, and insolence—
having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
I satisfied the Buddha,
ardent and watchful.
The Buddha was satisfied with me,
placed me at the head of those with the four analytical knowledges.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Kāḷudāyī recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kāḷudāyī thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Kāḷudāyittherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kāḷudāyī theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽kāḷudāyi therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Story of the Elder Kāḷudāyī is the fourth.
